name: Ibis Rotorua

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 1 night at the Ibis Hotel Rotorua in April 2007. For a walk-in room rate of $116 per night we got a typical Ibis hotel room on the 4/F with a lake view. Free carparking under the hotel was included.
reviews.title: Good Location, Value for Money Hotel

reviews.text: The Ibis Front Desk staff were very friendly and genuinely helpful in the nicest of ways and it was obvious that they seemed to enjoy going the extra distance to provide some valuable customer service without expectation of anything in return. They did not try to give us the desparate "hard sell on tours or anything else" like we had received from many motel and B&B operators that we enquired with prior to deciding to stay at the Ibis and which we found rather off-putting.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: The room was small but average for a 3 star property and was adequately furnished with a good king bed. The room had not long been vacated by previous guests and we found on entering it that the bathroom had a few things missed in the cleaning process but after a call to the Front Desk, someone from housekeeping arrived within a few minutes and quickly rectified the problems.
reviews.title: Adequate but uninspiring

reviews.text: The Ibis is well located in a quiet area of the city and is close to the lake, the lakeside parks and gardens, and within easy walking distance to city shops, restaurants, and entertainment. It and the adjoining Novotel are perhaps the best located hotels in Rotorua away from Fenton St where a lot of the other hotels and motels are located and which carries a very heavy traffic volume and has associated traffic noise.
reviews.title: Good
Very convienient location
reviews.text: We did not experience any odour problems whilst there.

The hotel has a good location overlooking the lake and is a very short walk to "Eat Street" - the lake end of Tutanakei Street where most of the restaurants are located. (I highly recommend the Wild Rice Thai restaurant - one of the best Gung Choo Chee I've had!)
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: The room was small but clean and well-equipped (tea/coffee facilities included). The optional breakfast was good.
reviews.title: Good base for Rotorua

reviews.text: Overall it was above average and a good base for Rotorua. I stayed one night; however, I'm not sure I'd have wanted to stay there for any length of time - it wasn't quite good enough for that.
reviews.title: Satisfied With Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a typical, tourist-standard hotel in Rotorua, and within easy walking distance of the town centre. Wider Rotorua attractions (eg. Rainbow Springs) are within easy reach by bus or taxi, and some attractions will do helpful hotel pick-ups.
reviews.title: Cultural experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is plain but quite modern. Our room was a reasonable size, and clean and tidy. Tea / coffee-making is available in the room.
reviews.title: Rotorus Excellent, Hotel Bad.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Central hotel

reviews.text: We were on the 4th floor in a recently re-decorated room. Lake views, large bed, fridge, safe, ensuite, plenty of towels & toiletries.
reviews.title: OK for work

reviews.text: Breakfast was $19 per person for cooked & continental.
reviews.title: Best value in Rotorua

reviews.text: Stayed here recently while at a conference in Rotorua. It was a clean enough room, though mine didn't have a view at all. The location was fantastic in terms of being able to stroll through town and down to the lakeside. A few things were just a bit tired though - the bathroom was TINY and the shower leaked all over the bathroom floor even with the door shut tight. Horrible linen and no spares to be found in the cupboards. The staff were really nice (the guy in the restaurant brought some food up to my room when I ordered it even though the Ibis don't do room service) and friendly. The restaurant was pretty terrible, just as there were few options and they were all fairly nasty types of food, but I found out later you could actually go to the brasserie at the Novotel and still charge it back to your room at Ibis. I found out too late though! All in all a fairly bland experience, but good enough for a business trip.
reviews.title: Friendly staff at the Hotel Ibis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have reviewed the Novotel, which is the sister Accor property and right next to the Ibis in Rotorua. I still usually prefer to stay at the Ibis for the following reasons:
reviews.title: Value and Convenience

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for one night in April. We have stayed in many Ibis hotels and this was one of the larger rooms we have had. The room was clean and the bathroom was a good size. We got a great price for the room but in hindsight we should have taken up the offer for breakfast for $15 as it is very expensive to get breakfast in town. We saw one place had toast for $12! Parking was easy.
reviews.title: Good for an Ibis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here, as you do, to take in the sights, sounds and smells - excellent first stop in North Island.
reviews.title: Reasonable chain hotel, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good value hotel, great location and fine for a short stay, easy enough to walk around town, the spa and civic gardens. You need transport for the tourist parks though.
reviews.title: Basic hotel, good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our bedroom faced onto the street but was not noisy and okay on size, overall a good standard for the money and nothing worn out. Breakfast was fine if not memorable, the staff we spoke to were friendly and courteous.
reviews.title: a gem

description: Ibis Rotorua is located on the shores of Lake Rotorua. The hotel features 145 rooms, a restaurant, bar and Internet access. The city centre is only a short walk away, offering easy access to the convention centre, Energy Event Centre, cafes and restaurants. Conference rooms and other facilities at the neighbouring Novotel Rotorua Lakeside are also available to guests.
